My sandwich was good, though I had goat cheese. I found I'm not really a fan of goat cheese. Who would have thunk it? Lol. 

It was still good considering, and their chips must be home made. I liked them though. My friend devoured her turkey sandwich. 

Great spot for talking and eating with a friend or two. If I ever end up back in Madison I'll definitely come back.

This is my favorite breakfast place in the Madison area! Manona is a bit of drive so I don't get there as often as I would like but the freindly, helpful employees and the consistent quality of both their food and coffee make it worth the trek. I recommend the smoked gouda grits, they're pretty great!

Cute spot with tasty coffee from a popular Midwestern roaster the name of which I can't remember at the moment. Good pastries. The donut muffin is aptly named. A friend liked the blueberry muffin. A bunch of seating, but it seems to get pretty packed mid to late morning on the weekend. Shares parking with a bunch of other places in a little strip mall, and we had to wait briefly.

I took my mom to Crema Cafe the last time she was in town after a co-worker recommended it to me. Oh man. I am so glad she did!!!

We got there around 8:30 on a Saturday morning and were able to order quickly & get a table. A line did form at the ordering counter soon after we arrived, but it seemed like the tables turned over quickly enough to accommodate just about everyone!

Both of our meals were amazing. I had the power grits (cheesy grits with bacon & an egg on top) and I seriously dream about that meal now. The grits were so cheesy & indulgent. My mom got the fungus scramble and we both really liked that too.

Go Crema Cafe!

My only complaint: a lot of the tables were near the door and it's winter, so we were pretty freezing during most of our meal. It wasn't the biggest deal, but it did impact our comfort while we ate. Then again, it's winter in Wisconsin, so I'm not sure what else I would expect.

We love Crema Cafe! Delicious sandwiches and coffee drinks, pleasant casual atmosphere, and friendly staff.  Our favorites include the Breakfast Sandwich, Bluebird, and Gobbler. And the Ham So Gouda. Oh and the Balsamic Beef. Okay so maybe pretty much everything we've tried is a favorite! 
The only downside for us is that they don't have a baby changing station in the restroom (and the restrooms are filthy), which is strange considering that on weekdays the place is full of moms with babies (but don't get the wrong idea, it's not a loud crazy place overrun with screaming kids, any kids I've ever seen there have been very well-behaved). Today we had to go out and change our daughter in the back of the car because there wasn't anywhere inside to do it. That's fine when the weather is nice, but not really an option when it's raining or cold outside.

The Roman II is to die for! As a vegetarian, it's not very often I get excited about a sandwich. Enter Crema. The Roman II has roasted zucchini, tomatoes, provolone, red onion, a delicious balsamic vinaigrette and some arugula to top it all off. (This is from memory. Allow me a few errors!) Each sandwich comes with homemade tortilla chips. The chips are seasoned with some sort of goodness. Both the sandwich and chips make for a perfect lunch. 

Beside sandwiches, Crema has bakery items, a wide range of coffee drinks, and rotating soups. I hear they have brunch but haven't had a chance to check it out. 

The staff is really friendly and they always have a smile on their face. It's the perfect little eatery. Be warned, around lunch time this place gets quite busy. If you want to grab lunch on your short lunch break, go ahead and preorder.

Their regular menu is great, but their specials are just that - special. I would say that 90% of the time I eat one I say something along the lines of "this is one of the best things I have ever eaten", and I truly mean it. 
The only thing holding them back from being 5 stars for me is that I don't enjoy the coffee selection they have out regularly (an important thing for me) and I wish they were open later. 
I keep wanting to eat brunch at different places around Madison, but I am continually drawn back to Crema. Also, it gets really busy, so plan ahead!
cute place, very nice people.. i too LOVED the bluebird sammich...and, i almost NEVER order  chicken salad( or tuna) out in a restaurant. You MUST try this sammich!

A solid choice if quality is a main consideration. I've enjoyed everything I've tried. 

My only gripes are sometimes I could have the bread just a tad less toasted- It makes the sandwiches a little harder to eat than they need to be- and sure, if you're REALLY hungry, you might need to supplement your meal with a pastry to really fill up, because the portions aren't large. But I can count on this place to use fresh, thoughtful and high quality ingredients and that's what matters most to me!

Been to Crema many times and keep wanting to like it there but the word "underwhelming" keeps popping up as it did for several other reviewers here. I have finally given up and hardly ever go there any more.
The food should be great since they use a lot of fresh, local ingredients but it always comes out Meh. The physical setup leaves a lot to be desired with the water and condiments against the wall which is also where people stand in line to get served which is also the path to the bathroom! Always a traffic jam there. 

The place gets very loud when it's busy and the service is awful. The help acts like they're doing you a favor by serving you. Based on the pathetic responses posted here by the Manager I now totally understand why the help's attitude is what it is. Note that he never takes responsibility for a customer's bad experience, like it's never his staff that might be the problem. Hmm ...

I loved this cozy independently-run cafe and the ambience. The food was excellent, and the ingredients were very fresh. The menu options were appealing, and I appreciated the variety of vegetarian selections.

Adorable little joint on a rainy Sunday morning. Loved their coffee and fun options for drinks. The plates weren't very large as far as breakfast goes - I could have eaten more. Overall though it's pretty quick and yummy and well priced

This was my first time here and it was great! Right when you walk in, you get that quaint breakfast cafe feel. The decor is perfect and welcoming. 

I got the sausage and peppers breakfast special. The sausage had great flavors and the peppers were roasted perfectly. Mix that together with the eggs, and it was a great breakfast. It also came with focchia bread to help soak up all the juices. It was surprising light and fluffy. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the side of mixed greens. It didn't seem to be dressed at all and was a little dry. Other than that, the meal was great!
Great location to sit outside with the perfect latte with the lake and the capital view on your horizon , love their sandwiches nothing ordinary always creative

I don't like the service style-stand in line, order, pay, sit down, get up to get your own coffee, sit down and your food is brought to you. It's just obnoxious. 
But the food and the coffees are very good. Quality ingredients, put together in an interesting combination. Very solid. We're weekend semi regulars and I could love the place if it weren't for the above.

I ordered the Lake Edge eggs and hash,  and I wasn't too impressed. It was supposed to come with 2 eggs, and what I got was not 2 eggs. The potatoes were a mix of regular and sweet potatoes--they were bland and dry. The sausage was the kicker for me. There was so much fennel seed in it, I couldn't taste anything else. I was drowning in a sea of fennel seeds. 

I was super unhappy when I left, and I went home and had second breakfast. I don't think I'll be back.

I absolutely love The Gobbler! I get this sandwich every time I'm there. I always upgrade to the greens instead of the chips bc they're lightly dressed and very fresh greens! The portions are perfect for the price. They do not skimp out. The Gobbler is piled high with turkey, cranberry relish, goat cheese, arugula and a touch of mayo. It's on a delicious wheat bread. Yum! I don't live close but it's worth the drive over!

It's quite a drive from downtown so I struggle to make it over this way often, but finally made it happen because Crema. 

After ordering up at the counter, we settled into our table and feasted on the cinnamon crumb coffee cake we snagged and mmm was that sugary goodness. We had planned on just tasting it then taking the rest home, but yeaa that did not happen. We finished off that piece of cake pretty quickly. 

With such a tasty start to the meal, we waited eagerly for the rest of the food. 
-scrambled eggs with sweet potato hash and whole wheat toast
-an egg white fungus scramble with whole wheat toast and greens
-a scramble of the day with whole wheat toast and greens
-one blueberry almond pancake

The toast was griddled up in butter, the greens were dressed, and the pancake was studded with blueberries. This was quality breakfast food. 

Throughout our meal, I was eyeing a little girl slurping on a very vibrantly purple and delicious looking smoothie, so I will be checking those out in my next trip. I've also seen pictures of the crema oatmeal and know I need that in my life soon. To be continued.

Crema is definitely in my top brunch spots in Madison. Just a little place in a strip mall, but has so much going for it. From great coffee and smoothies to awesome changing brunch specials and amazing pastries, this place is easy to love. I definitely recommend trying out a smoothie and a pastry if you're there - especially their savory pastries. Their scrambled are also very good, my go to is the fungus scramble. I love trying out their new specials. It can be busy on weekends, but usually I can always find a table if I wait just a little bit.

stated out with  Chai tea, which was served at the perfect temperature, ready to drink right away! I ordered the Tuna Sandwich, which was very good, and served with an abundance of mixed greens. The flavor was very interesting. It had a tangy, sourness that was unique and I quite enjoyed. I do wish it was served on a bigger plate, but really of little consequence.

The decorum is awesome, I love the retro feel and style. Being a graphic designer the design in a cafe just adds to the  experience for me. Great color scheme.

The staff was very courteous and knew some regulars by name, and greeted them as they entered the door. The service was fast and I didn't wait too long for my food. They told everyone leaving to have a good day. Although it may give off the young hip vibe, this place isn't just for modern day hipsters. As I was leaving a very elderly group of people came in to eat. Overall a great experience!

I do think the price should be more reflective of this though $$

Good service. Good ambience. Friendly staff.
Food... Meh... I have been to better breakfast places in Madison that have many more options on the menu.
The price on the items for the quantity of food is high in my opinion. I haven't had the "yummmm" feeling you get when you have really good breakfast here yet.
Might give it another try.

Don't think I will ever return on a weekend afternoon. Always way to busy, which I guess is a good thing for business, but I waited 30 minutes for 2 "to go" sandwiches (wanted to eat there, but never seems to be a table). Even the man who ordered after us got his food first somehow. It just seems that the service is a little confused (lots of very young workers). Sandwiches were pretty good, & the mango smoothy was good too, but it's tough to deal with the wait & unorganized service.
Fantastic smoothies, I actually crave them! The breakfast menu is always charming and delicious!

went here for brunch a couple times... haven't tried any of their drinks yet but the food was great!

got what i think was the bluebird sandwich which was really good, but kinda sweet and another sandwich that was warmed up made of chicken...sorry can't remember the name but that was really good too.

the staff is really nice and helpful... definitely a place to go to hang out with friends to talk and have something good to eat!

Delightful breakfast and lunch place across the street from a beautiful park and Lake Monona.  3 tables in front of this strip-mall restaurant, with quaint old formica kitchen tables and fiesta ware place settings inside.  Food is local and delicious. Delicious sandwiches and an awesomely flavorful range of egg dishes.  A mellow, family friendly place.

Yes. Just yes to everything about this adorable little cafe. 

High quality, locally sourced, ethical ingredients. Fair trade coffee. DELICIOUS everything I have ever tried. Brioche french toast is my favorite. 

Get's a little packed inside during the weekends for brunch, expected! But I have never had to wait for a table. Always seems to work out just fine. 

Food takes a little longer to come out that I would have expected, but it is SO worth the wait, and honestly I would rather wait a little longer knowing it's all being prepared fresh instead of it just being warmed up. 

I am a huge fan. Been here several times and I am certain I will be here several more in the future.

A small, cozy, bustling cafe near Madison's botanical gardens. A great place to hang and take advantage of the free wi-fi if you don't mind the noise of people coming and going. The staff always seems to know exactly what they're doing, though in my experiences haven't gone out of their way to be friendly. Good smoothies--I tried both the Gloomy Day and Peach Punch. I loved the Gloomy Day. It was thick and fruity and not overly sweet. It really brightened up my gloomy day! I also tried the ArtiMelt sandwich and loved it's flavor. Have yet to try anything off of Crema's tempting breakfast menu. I love that they use local eggs in their dishes!

Crema is great! This is our favorite neighborhood place for breakfast. The ingredients are fresh and high quality. It costs a little bit more than your typical greasy spoon, but the taste and quality make up for it.
